# CPContactCallButton

**Class**

A button for calling the contact.

## Declaration

```swift
class CPContactCallButton
```

## Overview

Use this button to call the template’s contact.

If your app doesn’t provide VoIP functionality, use the `tel` URL scheme to start a phone call with the contact. Invoke your template application scene’s [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/UIScene/open(_:options:completionHandler:)] method and pass the URL. CarPlay provides this scene to your [doc://com.apple.carplay/documentation/CarPlay/CPTemplateApplicationSceneDelegate] when the scene connects.

## Creating a Contact Call Button

- **init(handler:)**: Creates a button that invokes a handler when the user taps it.

## Managing Interactions with the Contact

- **actions**: The actions that the template displays for this contact.
- **CPContactDirectionsButton**: A button for getting directions to the contact’s location.
- **CPContactMessageButton**: A button that activates Siri and initiates the compose message flow.
